summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing travel approval and logistical planning for an interview in Stockholm, Sweden, related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails detail flight and hotel bookings, per diem issues, and reference several prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Dal
persons.context: Mentioned in a sarcastic comment about bureaucratic nonsense causing delays and absurdity in the travel approval process.

events.title: Planned Interview in Stockholm
events.description: The team requests travel approval for an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, scheduled for January 29th and/or 30th, 2020, as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Revised Travel Dates to Stockholm
events.description: Later emails adjust travel dates to depart JFK on February 3, 2020, and return from Stockholm on February 7, 2020, for the interview.

events.title: Interview Trip to Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles on December 16 and/or 17, 2019, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview Trip to Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview in Los Angeles on November 14, 2019, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview Trip to West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel request for an interview in West Palm Beach on November 4, 2019, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Victim Interview Trip to Los Angeles
events.description: Prior travel request for a victim interview in Los Angeles, tentatively scheduled for a week in June 2019.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prior travel request for approximately three days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel Approval for West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel request approved for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, for the case United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida
events.description: Initial travel request for two days of meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document is part of the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618) conducted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
It reveals ongoing international investigative efforts in early 2020, specifically planning for an interview in Stockholm, Sweden.
The emails reference multiple prior domestic trips in 2019 to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach for victim interviews related to the same case.
There is significant bureaucratic frustration expressed over travel logistics, including incorrect hotel locations in the booking system (E2) and costs exceeding per diem allowances.
The correspondence indicates coordination with the FBI's Legal Attach√© (Legat) and the U.S. Embassy for assistance with hotel bookings in Stockholm.
